Class Store

  • java.lang.Object
    • assignment2.Store

  • public class Store
extends java.lang.Object
    This class uses the Singleton pattern to represent a Store.
    Author:
    Stanislav Berezin

    • Constructor Detail

      • Store

        private Store()
        This class uses the Singleton pattern to represent a Store. The constructor is private to ensure only a single instance is created. The instance is accessed through a public method, which returns the instance.

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static Store getInstance()
        Part of the Singleton pattern, this method is used to access the single instance of the Store.
        Returns:
        instance

      • createGuiData

        public java.lang.Object[][] createGuiData()
                                   throws StockException
        This method creates a two dimensional array representing the stores inventory. The method is called from the GUI, in order to display the inventory as a table. Throws a StockException, if there is no inventory to display.
        Returns:
        data
        Throws:
        StockException - - throws this exception when there is no inventory to display

      • getStoreName

        public java.lang.String getStoreName()
        Returns the stores name.
        Returns:
        storeName

      • setStoreName

        public void setStoreName(java.lang.String name)
                  throws FormException
        Sets the stores name. Is called from the Introduction GUI, where the user is compelled to name the store using a form. Throws a FormException if no name is given.
        Parameters:
        name - - the stores name
        Throws:
        FormException - - throws this exception when the user leaves a form empty

      • getCapital

        public double getCapital()
        Returns the stores capital.
        Returns:
        capital

      • addCapital

        public void addCapital(double amount)
        Used to add to the store's capital.
        Parameters:
        amount - - the amount of capital to add

      • lowerCapital

        public void lowerCapital(double cost)
        Used to lower the stores capital.
        Parameters:
        cost - - the amount of capital to lower by

      • getInventory

        public Stock getInventory()
        Returns a Stock object containing the stores inventory.
        Returns:
        inventory

      • resetCapital

        public void resetCapital()
        Used to reset the stores capital to the initial value. Not used within the main program, but is required for unit testing.
